channel.title: Online command for wilderness..?
channel.description:
Hiiia,
Anyone know the code to check how much players there are in wilderness? like ::online , but to wilderness?
thanks!

item.title: Online command for wilderness..?

rofl how pointless this is, debating over something that does exactly the same thing, its really about if we wanna have 1 extra line of code or not. I’m sticking with what i said.

You stick with that, I’ll stick with winning.
[/quote]

HAHA u sir made me laugh :P[/quote]

^ That.

-kozy

item.title: Online command for wilderness..?
item.dc:creator: @KO9 KO9
item.description:
@KO9 wrote:

It’s not good practice… You’re adding a line of code which is not needed and this is NEVER a good thing to do, I’d be surprised if IDEs don’t complain about you doing it tbh, they should, I’m sure a code optimiser would.

If people don’t understand how a for loop works and add in code which doesn’t work as planned, it is their own fault for trying to modify code without knowing what it does in the first place and when they eventually realise, then they will likely remember.

Read full topic

item.title: Online command for wilderness..?
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

[quote=“KO9, post:10, topic:282288”][quote author=Peter link=topic=372982.msg2814541#msg2814541 date=1244208289]
We already had this conversation on IRC.

Result: I win, EOF.
[/quote]

that was tl;dr for me. plus I wanted to increase my e-peen :([br][br][size=1]Posted on: June 05, 2009, 07:28:11 am[/size][hr][quote author=xEnt link=topic=372982.msg2814543#msg2814543 date=1244208440]

Why the continue? Even you can’t break a loop with that if statement…

why not, good practice, sure i could have left it, or i could have thrown continue in so people google it and learn something.

Adding it is is NOT good practice. Pretty sure adding pointless lines of code is not following conventions.

sure it is, is it bad that I’m in a habit of using continue when i wanna get straight to the next player? I’m pretty certain its classed in the ‘better to be safe than sorry’ POV. What if there were more if statements to check after that? why let the CPU handle more instructions than skipping straight to what you need.
[/quote]
IF and when you need it, you add it, not when you don’t…[/quote]
You realize this is code to the open (especially moparscapers) what if they make a custom wilderness area and do something like

int count = 0;
for(Player p : world.getPlayers()) {
if(p.getLocation().inWilderness()) {
count++;
continue;
}

if(p.getLocation().x < 333 && p.getLocation().y > 555) {// psuedo
count++;
}
}

huh? what if they got their own custom location, status can change at anytime on here and i do believe its good practice. Right above me, this code if you remove continue, you give the CPU an extra instruction to process each player? why would you wanna do that? I see you 2 are trying to give me some fail++ here, but i didn’t know that thinking in the future, or good practice was not allowed?

gtfo nigga plx

Read full topic
